Liga Champions: Aksi Son Heung-min Minta Maaf ke Andre Gomes
07 Nov 2019, 01:13 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Insiden menjatuhkan gelandang Everton, Andre Gomes, amat membekas bagi penyerang Tottenham Hotspur, Son Heung-min. Pemain asal Korea Selatan ini pun mencoba menyampaikan permintaan maaf kepada Gomes saat Spurs meladeni Crvena Zvezda di pentas Liga Champions, Kamis dini hari, 7 November 2019 waktu Indonesia.
Di laga itu Spurs menang telak 4-0 atas tim tuan rumah. Son tampil gemilang dengan mencetak dua gol. Dua gol lainnya dikemas oleh Eriksen dan Lo Celso.
Usai mencetak gol, Son tidak merayakannya. Ia terlihat mendekat ke arah kamera. Son lantas mengangkat dan merapatkan kedua tangannya sambil menundukkan kepala. Jelas sekali dia sedang mengirim pesan yang penting.
Son mengatakan beberapa hari ini harus menghadapi situasi yang sulit. Namun semua orang memberikan dukungan kuat kepada dia.
"Saya benar-benar meminta maaf atas insiden dan situasi yang terjadi (lawan Everton). Tentu saya harus fokus ke tim dan ini sebagai bentuk rasa hormat kepada mereka," sebut Son.
Di sisi lain, Gomes mengeluarkan pernyataan pertama usai insiden tackle. Dalam akun media sosial Twitter, pemain asal Portugal ini mengucapkan terima kasih atas segala dukungan yang diberikan. Saat ini ia tengah berada bersama keluarganya.
Sebelumnya, di laga Everton kontra Spurs di Liga Inggris, Gomes mengalami patah kaki saat berduel dengan Son. Ia diprediksi absen hingga akhir musim dan diragukan tampil membela Timnas Portugal di pentas Piala Eropa 2020.

Champions League: Son Heung-min's Apology to Andre Gomes
Nov 7 2019, 01:13 by the translation, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The incident of dropping Everton midfielder Andre Gomes has left a mark on Tottenham Hotspur's attacker Son Heung-min. The South Korean player also tried to convey an apology to Gomes when the Spurs served Crvena Zvezda in the Champions League stage, early Thursday morning, November 7, 2019 Indonesian time.
In that game Spurs won 4-0 over the home team. Son performed brilliantly by scoring two goals. The other two goals were packed by Eriksen and Lo Celso.
After scoring goals, Son did not celebrate. He looks closer to the camera. Son then raised and closed his hands while lowering his head. He was clearly sending an important message.
Son said that in recent days he had to face a difficult situation. But everyone gave him strong support.
"I am really sorry for the incident and situation that happened (against Everton). Of course I have to focus on the team and this is a form of respect for them," said Son.
On the other hand, Gomes issued the first statement after the tackle incident. In the Twitter social media account, the Portuguese player thanked for all the support given. He is currently with his family.
Previously, in the Everton game against Spurs in the Premier League, Gomes suffered a broken leg during a duel with Son. He is predicted to be absent until the end of the season and is doubtful to appear for Portugal national team in the European Cup 2020 stage.
